Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Bala Rajagopalan "Bala"
Reviews.Content: If you want a basic laptop with excellent price to performance, this is a good choice. Looks and feels sturdy, minimum flex, relatively light, excellent display (fonts could be sharper), very nice keyboard, DVD writer, and enough RAM (4GB) and HD (320 GB) for normal home use.  No HDMI port, weak sound, and no fancy bells and whistles. Battery life seems to be reasonable (3 hrs fully charged on a 6-cell battery). Overall, an excellent value for money, especially compared to similarly configured Dell, Sony, or Toshiba (which cost anywhere from $150 to $250 more).

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Laptop For Productivity
Reviews.Author: M. Leeth
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review short and sweet. This laptop is perfect for those looking to do every day tasks.Pros:1. Great price for performance. Although I upgraded the SSD, which made a significant improvement, even without the laptop is quick.2. Easy to upgrade, if desired. Removing the back panel reveals the CPU and hard drive bay. Personally I had a 80GB SSD sitting around from my previous laptop so I replaced the 320GB HD with it. Huge improvement, instantaneous loading is FTW.3. Good battery life. After a few discharges, I'm currently getting ~3 hours of battery life with non-intensive use.Cons:1. Headphone static when laptop is plugged in. Not overwhelming but clearly there. Seems to be a common issue with G560's.2. Laptop charger cord is a little short. Another foot would have been much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: srtalukdar
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine. Looks good. Screen, Keyboard, battery life is good (over 3 hours). Does not get hot however long you use. Lighter than expected. Only the sound quality is a bit dull and low. I would recommend to friends, acquaintances with a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: I shopped ALL around- best choice for the money.
Reviews.Author: reflectionmommy "reflectionmommy"
Reviews.Content: Okay- first things first.This laptop is NOT high end.  I am used to that as I am typing on a 6 year old Everex machine that I have pared down to run very smoothly and has never given my any problems that I did not create.  SO.  I understand low-end, economy, yet I want it to do the max possible for the dollar.  This is it in my opinion.  Even though it is not top-notch in some areas, what you get for around $400 or so, I feel is WELL worth this small expense.Some highlights.Textured plastic case.  No fingerprints.  Some have remarked negatively about the touchpad.  It is textured as well- that may be their issue.  So, at first, when you are using it, your finger does not slide easily.  It is a matter of pressure as I got used to it within a minute.It is a dual core Pentium, albeit a basic one.  No hyperthreading and some of the other tech that takes basic to WOW.  Big HDD for the price- spin speed is 5400 on the HDD.  Hmmmmm.  As it says- for surfing, burning the occasional disc off, and general computing needs, I think that this does a great job.We have kids, and I was worried about OneKey restore being right there for all to see on the upper part of the deck above the keyboard!  Yikes.  Can't disconnect the use of the key (at least I haven't found a way yet), but it can be password protected.  So I am cool with that.It is relatively light @ not quite 6 lbs.  Replacement batteries aren't that expensive, and, should you need to go portable around the house, 4 hours is plenty to sit and research something, or do a bit more.  Haven't done much else with it, so I may come back and list some other plusses or minuses as they arise.Bottom line- the computer that this is replacing, another Everex that utterly died after almost all day, everyday use for about 5 years, met our expectations- (not exceeded) THIS Lenovo will continue to exceed.Update: 3.15.2011Still great.  After loading up all that we needed to, our programs, photos, screensaver, extras, catching up on all of the updates from various and sundry places... still GREAT.  Web: Browsing is only a second or two delay and then nearly instantaneous on filling out the whole page.  Do remember that this machine is not tops on anything- so I find the speed exceptional.  I had 3 different programs in various stages of loading, downloading, and installation, and they were all done in lightspeed fashion, with no locking up, no hold ups, no hitches.  Done in a New York Minute.Keyboard is well arranged, responsive, and does not miss a beat.  Dual number key pads... sometimes an assistance.Hate to say it, never been overboard on Microsoft products, but Seven is good.  No problems so far, like Vista.  Always had to come up with workarounds for that OS.  Ugh.  Not so here.  All set up and customized.  Works GREAT and without any hitches with the various Freeware that I use.  You know, let me touch on that one.I have NEVER had a computer crash due to anything other than hardware failure due to heavy use and age.  With that said, here are the programs that I like to use, again it is all Freeware, and all of it is from CNET.  Here is the list, in order of use to clean up your system entirely:Free Registry FixCOMODO System CleanerIObit Advanced System CareSpyware TerminatorIObit Smart Defrag #2 BetaI find that these programs work very well together, no matter what OS you use from XP through Windows 7, cause no conflicts, and keep your system totally clean of everything, and running as fast as is possible.Screen quality is great.  Very tight for roughly 720 video and picture quality.Lastly- sound quality is great.  Once you dive into Windows to customize your setting, you come across an area of sound customization, including I believe 10 band graphic equalizer, or presets like concert, rock, or classical and the like- and, then you can set up the 3d perceptual range and some other functions.  Very nice.  Makes these little speakers sound so much better, so much more presence, and even, dare I say it, a little note of 3D digitally manipulated Bass?  Surprising, but true!Buy this computer.  I love it, and have had an easy time of things using it, setting it up, and the customization of Windows is a lot of fun.Buy it.  I have no cons on this for the price.  Not one.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G650 Series 067999U
Reviews.Author: SSD
Reviews.Content: So far, this laptop has been wonderful. Windows-7 is a bit of a learning curve if you're used to XP (like I am), but so far it's been simple to use. My only complaint is this product came with some bloat/crapware along with important Lenovo software--I accidentally uninstalled something thinking it was bloatware only to realize it was a needed file (it was Easy-Camera). Re-downloading the needed software resulted in being given the runaround (in the end, I had to download a Vista version of the program because Windows7-64 bit just wouldn't work with the download). It would be nice if Windows would more clearly specify what's an important file versus what's not (not just specifying for system files) so the laymen out there don't accidentally delete things, but oh well.When the fan blows, it's rather quiet. I haven't had any issues of the laptop overheating. The speed is wonderful, too, very fast. The image quality and sound is pretty good, I haven't had much problems compared to the other reviews. What's also interesting is you have the option to create a face-recognition log-in using the camera instead of signing it; it's a neat touch.For those who use word-processing files, you'll have to either buy Office or go with something like Openoffice instead (the latter of which I did). This laptop also comes with McAfee, which I ditched that in favor of Spybot and Avira; it's best to go with your personal preference for virus/spyware protection.Overall, I'm VERY pleased with the quality of this laptop. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Best out similar laptops
Reviews.Author: Kiri Amarakoon
Reviews.Content: I researched several laptops such as HP, Dell, Gateway, Toshiba for sveral months with similar features and when this came up for sale for $399 I jumped at it since it had very good reviews and met my key criteria.The two things I am disappointed with are the battery life which is less than 3 hours compared to over 5 hours on my Dell which cost over $600,and the touch pad. The touch pad is not an issue since I got a wireless mouse for under $20.I have used it for a couple of months and I am very pleased with it,the features and the cost make up for the shortcommings.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for more value for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent deal for the price. I am happy with all aspects of this Lenovo Laptop. It performs well, and does everything I want it to. I appreciate that the processor runs so cooly, and provides enough computer power for my needs, which are administrative and for video. I am not involved in video gaming, so more processor power is not a necessity for me. The screen is good, I am happy with the sound quality, even though its speakers are not very loud. I use headphones anyway. Also, I am beginning to like Windows 7. I would recommend this laptop highly, it is perfect for those like me, whose computing needs are not overly specialized.

Reviews.Title: Great. Fast. Reliable.
Reviews.Author: AV
Reviews.Content: What else can you ask of a laptop?I have generally had good luck with Lenovos.... I would stick with the brand - if only they made a larger screen resolution (I do a lot of photography), I would be a VERY happy camper, as opposed to just a happy camper. 768 vertical is a bit short, considering that older 15.4" laptops did 1280x800....Otherwise, it is a very good laptop, slick, not too many bells and whistles, but reliable and reputable (former IBM). If only fewer things were pre-loaded - but they do not hinder performance of a powerful processor and plenty of RAM this one has...

Reviews.Title: Don't Try to Use TrueCrypt to Encrypt the Entire Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: honestjd
Reviews.Content: I have had very good luck with this product, but with one exception.When I tried to use TrueCrypt to encrypt the entire hard drive, it turned the laptop into a brick.  The BIOS is not compatible.  Fortunately, after much effort, I found a way to decrypt the drive using the rescue disk.  It took almost a full day.If you use TrueCrypt with this machine, only create encrypted folders.  Do not try to encrypt the entire machine.

Reviews.Title: Customer service is terrible
Reviews.Author: Zhengxu He
Reviews.Content: We bought a Lenovo laptop, and its screen suddenly freezes. It was sent for repairs for 3 times and they were unable to fix it. The customer service was playing games on us when we tried to resolve the problem. After spending hours and hours, we gave up and simply dumped the computer into the trash can.I swear I would never buy a Lenovo again.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE
Reviews.Author: S. R. HUDSON "raenboe"
Reviews.Content: I've had my computer for less than a month.  It has a really nice screen quality, the keyboard is comfortable, it processes quickly, the speakers are located on the top unlike my Samsung Netwbook so watching videos I hear more without my headhones.  So what is the main drawback...this computer comes loaded with AD ware for lenovo.  After about an hour or so, no matter what you are doing (one guy was in the middle of a presentation) it will pop up on your screen.  And from what I've heard from other users it up dates with the regular Lenovo updates.  I have found a couple of suggestions for removal/disabeling this but for the most part it seems nearly impossible.  For the money I'm very happy with my computer, but I have to admit had someone told be before hand I might have went with the other company that was available to me at the time.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G560-06799U
Reviews.Author: little strump
Reviews.Content: This product looks decent for the price.The set up process is quite simple and practical.If you are lucky enough everything is going well like other laptop. In my case, the internet wireless card is not working and the system hung up each time I connected to the internet. Therefore, I had to return this product and bought another one from other brand.

Reviews.Title: bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Bill Smith
Reviews.Content: owned it for a bout a few months. so problem so far. run everything well (not a gamer, so cannot speak for that).

Reviews.Title: Give it a 9!
Reviews.Author: Ray "Electronics Lover"
Reviews.Content: Machine is fast and convenient. Could be a little lighter and LCD a little sharper but at the price - it's a winner.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing - don't buy one of these
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes when buying this Lenovo G560 Laptop - it seemed like a bargain. But don't be fooled... it isn't worth half the money. The touch pad is next to useless - the buttons aren't well defined and the touchpad is confused when you rest one finger on the button and try to navigate with the other... I have had many laptops and none have been this incredibly hard to use... I have updated software, changed drivers etc, but it seems like  many others share this problem. It is like haveing a loose steering wheel on a car - sometimes it steers and sometimes not!The other issue is that the computer freezes whne you shut the lid or leave it for a while - it doesn't effectively go into hibernate or standby, so the only option is to turn it off. Again - I have had many laptops, and none are really brillliant at power managment but this is the pits.Stay away from this - after reading many forum posts, the company seem to be useless at responding, both to enquiries, or to overcoming repeated design faults as they bring out new models. Never buying Lenovo again.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: DoubleStars
Reviews.Content: I bought two pieces in one year. Both have been working great.It's light weight, less heat and high speed. Much better than Dell or HP I owned before.

Reviews.Title: takes a beating!
Reviews.Author: Elad
Reviews.Content: This was a cheap computer that has served us amazingly well. It has held up to all of our technological tests (as big as they are for simple home use) but really held up well to our physical test. My six year old daughter was retrieving the laptop from upstairs and bringing it downstairs when she tripped on the cord and DROPPED the computer. The computer banged down the entire flight of wooden  stairs and it landed on the tile floor at the bottom. The computer stayed together (the battery didn't even pop out) and still functions like it is right off the shelf!  Bravo  Lenovo!

Reviews.Title: Lenova G560
Reviews.Author: fred s
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my wife as a replacement for her 5 year old HP. A BIG MISTAKE.To lower the cost of this computer Lenova used the worst Touch Pad and Key Board you can find.If you can't type and only use a mouse you might not have a problem. But if you type often andactually use the touch pad you will hate this computer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect laptop for everyday useages
Reviews.Author: COMPUTER GEEK
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is perfect for everyday use. I have owned this laptop for about 2 months, and I am very happy. It's reasonably fast; the keyboard is excellent; the weight is OK; and the build is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: wish I could give a minus star
Reviews.Author: Native Son
Reviews.Content: Had my G560 less than a month before it crashed. After a long time on the web site  I found a number to call for warrenty work.They said to send for repair at my expence. That was $20.00 at UPS. They have now had my laptop for two weeeks and cannot give me date for repair. It turns out the motherboard failed and guess what.... they don't have any !!! and cannot give me any time frame. They just said thay were sorry for the delay.I assume they are having so many failures they cannot meet the demand for repair parts. Buyer beware.... sounds like the IBM of old!!!

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: H. S. McQuate
Reviews.Content: As with most Lenovo laptops, this is a good value. It comes with many features for the price and Windows 7 is certainly an improvement over Vista.

Reviews.Title: Good and cheap
Reviews.Author: C. Meadows
Reviews.Content: Great computer for business.  We give them to our service tech who are unbeleivably hard on laptops.  These stand up to the beating, have decent performance and are cheap to replace if they really do a number on them.  Decent screen too.  They're truely awesome if you get one for around $300, which can be done.

Reviews.Title: On the Fence
Reviews.Author: Hope "HEntz"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Lenovo from a local (trusted) retailer on Nov 1, 2011. By December 14, 2011, the screen has no video. I cant see anything.  It fires up, it lights up, all sounds appear to be working....but no video.  I do not travel with this machine, or carry it around, it sits at home on my desk, pretty much 24-7.  I propmtly called Lenovo and (luckily, since I've only had it for 44 days..) it's still under warranty. I packed it up and shipped it off to Texas to their repair center.  They said 7 days repair time.  I'll be happy if that's the case for repair, but the fact that this machine is so new, and it's had this kind of hardware problem, makes me wonder if I should have bought a better brand name laptop.  So Im only giving them 2 stars right now. I'll follow up when I get it back on the customer service.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Kyle Bairdsen "Kyle Baird"
Reviews.Content: Battery life is poor but aside from that it's a great computer for the price.  Keyboard and screen are nice and I like the matte black finish, runs fine.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G560 Series 067999U Laptop (Black)
Reviews.Author: pedro
Reviews.Content: Lenovo G560 Series 067999U Laptop (Black)  perfect portable device for work and for personal use completely satisfied with the team

Reviews.Title: Cheap And Functional: All You Need
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom, who has been begging for a laptop for a while. I am a Mac girl myself, so I found it a little bewildering and difficult to use. But my son's guidance helped her and she loves it. Not everybody needs a souped up super machine- this one is good and cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price!
Reviews.Author: D. Scott
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with this purchase. I use it for college. It picks up wi-fi signals very quick. The battery life is good considering. EVERY not listed is a pro!The only cons are: It does need a larger hard drive, but as long as I keep my torrents under control it'll be ok. I use a laptop mouse and sometimes the function key doesn't want to turn off the touchpad. Also, the facial recognition software is a joke. It won't recognize me or let me reset the pics already in it. It's about to be un-installed.All and all, GREAT laptop for school. I may buy my daughter one soon!

Reviews.Title: Very good deal
Reviews.Author: ssinha
Reviews.Content: All works well for someone doing the general stuff like browsing or some web video streaming.....audio is not that great

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Good John
Reviews.Content: Have been using it for a few months. Very nice no problem at all with the things I am doing. Regarding the touchpad: it might needs some adjusting but it is not too bad; or you might want to just a good mouse. Regarding customer service: really, I don't use that for most products I purchase; if I have a problem, I just read the manual and do some online search.

Reviews.Title: If you never have a problem, great computer but if you do...
Reviews.Author: S. A. ROBBINS "shirley_rw"
Reviews.Content: I have repeatedly emailed Lenovo to get a simple question answered regarding my Lenovo computer and all I get is that I should call a 1-800 number. I have called and gave up after being on hold forever. I regret ever having bought a Lenovo computer and will never buy another one.While it might be a good machine, if you ever need service, have a question or have a problem, talk to a tree as you would have a better chance of getting an answer.

Reviews.Title: Muy mal servicio de Lenovo y el vendedor RedCore Computer
Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Este equipo a pesar de que no lo he podido probar la descripción que quiero hacer no es para criticar el equipo, esta es para que presten atención al pésimo servicio de garantía que ofrece lenovo e igualmente RedCore Computer, este mencionado anteriormente fue el almacén quien me vendió el equipo en noviembre del 2010, recibí el equipo en perfecto estado sin embargo al encender este por primera vez presento una falla en la intensidad de luminosidad de la pantalla ya que esta se muestra con muy poca energía por tal motivo le escribí al vendedor RedCore Computer el cual me dijo que la garantía de este equipo era directamente lenovo, luego de esto llamo a lenovo para exponer la falla que presenta el equipo, luego lenovo para la supuesta garantía me enviaron un formato con las piezas que debería enviarles, la dirección donde seria recibida, luego envié el equipo a la dirección  al cabo de una semana el equipo lo recibo desde lenovo y presentando la misma falla de un principio, ahora estoy en Caracas, Ven y llamo a lenovo y la única alternativa que me presentan es que debo enviar de nuevo a USA el equipo para que revisen nuevamente la falla que presenta.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Bowen
Reviews.Content: if you do not need a professional notebook, this one is good choose for you. but if you need to run some software which need better hardware, please choose something else.

Reviews.Title: Touchpad Problems
Reviews.Author: Inter
Reviews.Content: This laptop  is riddled with touchpad issues. If you are comfortable using your laptop with an external USB mouse and never use the touchpad then you can get this laptop. IMHO, I will never ever buy a Lenovo product again.Other than that, the laptop works good for basic use (word processing, internet browsing, movies and music). The built-in audio is horrible. You have to either have earphones or connect externally to speakers to hear any sound. The laptop comes with bloated Lenovo software which makes the system extremely slow. There are about 10 horrible and useless piece of Lenovo software that they bundle which you can uninstall and probable make the system more stable and fast.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality - I don't recommend.
Reviews.Author: my_2_cents
Reviews.Content: My review is based on the Lenovo value line G Series(G450).The body is very fragile and it feels like it is made of poor quality plastic. The display quality was good however the software was very buggy. Laptop froze several times. Veriface does not work. The software bundle that comes with the laptop is of no good.The laptop was sparingly used for 15-16 months and finally the laptop crashed. Unfortunately, my onsite warranty ended after 12 months.I was informed by the technician that I need to replace the motherboard which is going to cost me as much as a new laptop.I wouldn't recommend this unless you are looking for a use and throw laptop and don't plan to store any important data or pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for school purpose!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pial
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my nephew who is in 5th grade and so far he is pretty fine with it except for the fact that it was not a gaming machine but it's okay I knew it was not a gaming machine and I bought this so that he can only do his work........!!!1Good PerformenceSmoothLove One Key RecoveryGood for rough use

Reviews.Title: Not the best for Windows XP-ers
Reviews.Author: Samuel Bluefarb
Reviews.Content: I wasn'tr aware until I read some of the reviews that there was a "high end" Lenovo. If so, I must have purchased long ago (2005) one of those "high end" laptops Model #8922 (Series 3000), a square, rectangular--looks like about a 13" or 14" inch--screen. This machine has served me well, and I was able to download the Microsoft Word 2003 from its CD-ROM drive, a smooth and easy program. What disillusioned me with the Lenovo G650 was the "free" Microsoft Word 2010 program. I do quite a bit of writing for academic periodicals, both print and and lately on line. But this word processor (2010) is a nightmare for someone who did not go through the sequence of changes from 2003 to the present 2010. (Gradual learning curve) instead of being plunged into the 21st cent.with small prepartion for the "advances" in technology, much of which is self-defeating.(Not user friendly)The "'Easy' Transfer" of files from the older computer to this new one is a myth. Unless you are a tech mavin you will find this procedure impossibly difficult. You're supposed to use an external drive, a flash drive in my case, insert it into the older laptop, search for an "Easy Transfer" icon, or tab--which I couldn't find--then plug it back into the new one. Surprise and shock! When I attempted to download my files from the flash drive to My Docs in the new computer, I found that half my files were wiped out--probably due to the switch from Wind. XP to Wind. 7). I thought I'd try it again with an ancient floppy. But when I later opened up a file, I found to my bewilderment that the text had become an ungodly scramble of cryptographs (Again, Win. 7). Also, when attempting to download a file, or files, a series of windows would appear with a multitude of instructions. It got so that in order to figure out what they meant--I tend to be impatient--one would need a week of tutorials. And I can't afford that luxury. (I'm WWII vet, so time, in my case, is of the essence.) When writing, I type rapidly, and it's very frustrating to type a sentence or two, then have a window come up for no reason at all--maybe I touched the wriong key. But what finally decided me to give up on the G650--which i purchased on line for approx. $400+--is that many of my articles require footnotes. The footnote function on my old Lenovo is a masterpiece of simplicity. On the G650--well, I spent over an hour trying to locate the footnote function. I finally googled to see if there were others who had that problem. One man, who seemed to be far more knowledgeable on computer technology, found himself with the same frustrating barrier. My nephew, some 2000 miles away in Michigan, who's been a computer user since the early DOS , pre internet days, e-mailed me a link that's intended to instruct on the Microsoft Word 2010. But I'm no longer interested in time-consuming experimentation. I've gone back to my earlier square screen workhorse, and will sell the new one to a fellow who's interested. An ddded note. The numlock key numbers are imprinted on the keys of my Lenovo 8922. On the G650, the numlock has a separate keyboard, on the right of the conventional keyboard. I had to cover it with a piece  of cut-to-size cardboard to avoid tapping its keys and creating yet another poroblem, since motor habits hsve become so ingrained into the cerebral cortex that you can't avoid touching that superfluous numlock board. As for Shirley, Shirley, please don't think that all Lenovos are "poor," They are probably still making high end, perfectly good machines. And even this G650 is a good machine, but not for me, an XP, ancient user.I gave it three stars since I average out all of the atars, and came up with approx. three, not becauser the machine itself is so bad (The web pages are fine and my 12 bucks a month aol e-mail format which i downloaded onto it, worked as well as on my older Lenovo. But that Word Pricessor... ?  N'yet!A final PS. This is a problem with many touchpads that make sending e-mails a nightmare--words and characters getting jumbled out of sequence, so that part of a sentence or phrase, ends up in some other part of the e-mail message. But that problem with the G650 becomes an exponential disaster. Another time consuming headache, since you need to go back and move the words and phrases back and fit them into their proper syntactical order. I am typing this in the amazon window, and the errors are typos due to my impatient speed, not a shifting of whole phrases and sentence fragments. But then I'm also typing this on my old PC.

Reviews.Title: Worked for less than one year.
Reviews.Author: Vitaliy
Reviews.Content: Hard disk drive failed after 11 months and 3 weeks of use. Gives me a "disk read error occurred" at the start up. Windows won't load.

Reviews.Title: Pro's & Con's
Reviews.Author: yodo1919
Reviews.Content: I have owned the G560 for about 6 months now and many of the features are great , yet the big down fall is the keyboard and the on board mouse (touch pad) system. I would not recommend this computer for anybody who planning on typing a lot (unless you have an external keyboard & mouse) . Also there is not an input for a stereo (left & Right channels  . This is a draw back if you want to record any old medium styles.  If i had to buy another laptop I would look else where. It has never crashed and it is great for the Internet, also you will have to find new software that works in the 64 bit environment.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: iyyappan
Reviews.Content: I am not using it. I brought it for a friend in India. He is pleased with performance and cost

Reviews.Title: Bastante buena para tener ese precio
Reviews.Author: Roger Quiros
Reviews.Content: La computadora es bastante buena para el precio que tiene, al verdad aquí en costa rica una computadora con esas características la venden con precios cercanos o incluso superiores a los $1000, hasta el momento no me ha defraudado, incluso puedo jugar Company of Heroes y Assassins Creed con buenas gráficas y sin problemas en ella. Claro esta que la computadora no podrá correr cualquier juego que desee y también esta el detalle que la batería se le acaba demasiado rápido, prácticamente debes mantenerla pegada a la pared. Pero en realidad si no se posee mucho dinero y no quieres comprar te una netbook o si no la quieres para jugar juegos de ultima generación y mas bien la quieres para realizar trabajos de la universidad o similar, la verdad esta computadora estará mas que suficiente para ello.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Pentium Dual Core Processor 2GHz
4GB SO-DIMM RAM
320GB 5400RPM Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, Intel Graphics HM55
WIN 7 HOME PREMIUM 64 BIT, 3 hours Battery Life
ProductInfo.Name: Lenovo G560 Series 067999U Laptop (Black)
